appDesc.description: (2) A description of what the application does. This extension is used to...
appDesc.message: Quickly resolve digital object identifiers to their web destinations

iconHover.description: (3) The tooltip message displayed to a user when the mouse hovers on the extension's icon

optionContextMenu.description: (5) A setting to enable a feature where a user can highlight a DOI on a webpage, and then right click the selected text to see a 'Resolve DOI' in the context menu
optionContextMenu.message: Enable right-click context menu for selected text

optionMetaButtons.description: (6) A setting to enable additional buttons in the popup

optionCustomResolver.description: (7) A setting to enable custom entry of DOI and ShortDOI resolvers

textDoiResolverInput.description: (8) Label for text box where a URL will be entered for DOIs

textShortDoiResolverInput.description: (9) Label for text box where a URL will be entered for ShortDOIs

doiOutputUrlExample.description: (10) Label for the currently set resolver URL

optionAutoLink.description: (11) A setting to enable the extension to scan every page visited by the user and convert DOI codes into clickable links.
optionAutoLink.message: Automatically turn DOI codes on web pages into links

autoLinkInfo.description: (12) Cautionary remarks about the autolink feature
autoLinkInfo.message:
The autolink feature requires permission to access and modify pages you are viewing.
You may need to restart Chrome for this option to take effect.

optionsDescription.description: (13) Notice about external services used by the extension and where to submit bug reports
optionsDescription.message: This extension uses dx.doi.org, datacite.org, and crossref.org to resolve links and obtain metadata.

resolveSubmit.description: (14) The text that appears on the button to submit a DOI code for resolving

citeSubmit.description: (15) The text that appears on the button to start the citation generator

contextText.description: (16) When a user highlights a DOI on a webpage and right clicks on the highlighted text, this entry appears in the context menu to resolve the DOI

invalidDoiAlert.description: (17) A warning presented to user if the DOI code is not valid

citeTitle.description: (18) The title on the citation generator page

citeStyle.description: (19) A label next to the style chooser for formatted citations

citeLocale.description: (20) A label next to the locale chooser for formatted citations

loading.description: (21) A temporary message while resources load

noCitationFound.description: (22) A notice to the user that a citation could not be found

needCitationPerm.description: (23) A notice to the user that additional permissions must be accepted for the citation generator to work
needCitationPerm.message: Citations are retrieved from data.crossref.org and dx.doi.org. This permission must be accepted before the generator will function.

qrTitleLabel.description: (24) A setting to include the title of the reference in a generated QR code.
qrTitleLabel.message: Include title of reference in QR code

qrSize.description: (25) A label for the dimension of the QR image

invalidQrSizeAlert.description: (26) A warning presented to user if the QR image size entered is too large or too small

qrDisabled.description: (27) A notice that QR title retrieval is not enabled

qrTitleStatus.description: (28) Label for status of title retrieval for QR encoding

qrTitleSuccess.description: (29) Successful status of title retrieval for QR encoding

qrTitleFailure.description: (30) Failing status of title retrieval for QR encoding

qrMessageEncoded.description: (31) Label for message encoded in QR code

qrSave.description: (32) Instructions on how to save QR image
qrSave.message: Click on the image to save it

optionCustomResolverSelection.description: (33) Settings to allow choice of default or custom resolver

optionCrAutolink.description: (34) Label to choose whether custom resolver is enabled for autolinker

optionCrBubble.description: (35) Label to choose whether custom resolver is enabled for bubble

optionCrContext.description: (36) Label to choose whether custom resolver is enabled for context menu

optionCrOmnibox.description: (37) Label to choose whether custom resolver is enabled for omnibox

optionCrLabelBubble.description: (38) Label for choice of custom or default resolver in bubble

optionOmniboxOpento.description: (42) Label for selectable option to open omnibox queries in current or new tab
optionOmniboxOpento.message: Omnibox entry should by default open result in:

optionAutolinkApplyto.description: (46) Label for selection of protocols where autolink should be applied
optionAutolinkApplyto.message: ↪ Apply autolink feature to pages with protocol(s):

syncDataInfo.message: You must have Chrome Sync enabled for this feature to work correctly. This option should be manually enabled on each Chrome installation where you would like sync to occur. The following options are not included in sync because they require permissions to be accepted by the user before enabling: Autolink, QR title fetch.

optionSyncData.message: Synchronize this extension's settings across Chrome installations
